title: One Restaurant’s Survival Strategy: ‘Time Is of the Essence Here’
sub_head: The new documentary ‘Saving the Restaurant’ follows restaurateur Bobby Stuckey as he advocates for an industry in crisis even as he and his staff fight to keep their own business afloat
body:
“I GOT IT. White Corolla.” And with that, a masked Bobby Stuckey bounds out the front door of his restaurant Frasca Food and Wine in Boulder, Colo., carrying a white paper takeout bag and a wine bottle to the waiting vehicle.
This scene takes place 16 minutes into a new documentary, now streaming on SOMM TV, called “Saving the Restaurant.” The film chronicles Mr. Stuckey’s part in a nationwide effort to do just that, as well as the various ways in which he and his staff have had to rethink their day-to-day operations in order to survive.
